Good work, Kiryu-san! I have the results of
your current RIZAP Challenge. Please stop by
RIZAP whenever you have a chance!

59.2:
This time, please eat steak!
I recommend a lean cut!

60.2:
This time, please eat yakiniku! I recommend
meat that doesn't have too much fat!

61.2:
This time, please eat some quality yakiniku!
I request that you go with meat that doesn't
have much fat!

62.2:
This time, please eat sashimi! Avoid eating
sushi since it contains rice!

63.2:
This time, please eat saraudon! Since the
objective is to bulk up, noodles are good
today!

65.2:
This time, please eat fried rice! Since the
objective is to bulk up, carbs are a-okay!

66.2:
This time, please eat soba! Find your nearest
soba restaurant and go!

67.2:
This time, please eat champon! They serve
it at that one place. Just go eat it!

68.2:
This time, please eat a beef bowl! Since the
objective is to bulk up, carbs are a-okay!

69.2:
This time, please eat seafood! Any assortment
would be great!

70.2:
This time, please eat some avocado! It could
be called nature's butter!

83.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, let's go for a
dish low in sugar and high in protein. Oh,
yeah... I suggest a nutritious dish that's
packed with lobster! Well then, best of luck!

84.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, let's go for a
bulk-up meal. Let's see... I suggest a dish
where you can consume rice, pork, and egg
all together! Well then, best of luck!

85.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, let's go for a
well-balanced meal. Okay... I suggest a quick
meal that has carbs, eggs, and veggies! It's at
a place you'd stop by when you just need a
light meal! Their homemade soup has a great
flavor! Well then, best of luck!

86.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! Now, let's go for a
bulk-up meal. Hmm... I suggest a rice dish
topped with lots of thin pork slices! These pork
slices are often used in some noodle dishes too!
Well then, best of luck!

87.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, let's go for a
dish that's a big hit with kids. Let's see...
Maybe something that's packed with juicy meat
and cooked on a hot iron plate! I suggest you
eat around 300 grams of it! Well then, best of
luck!

88.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! Now for a go-to training
dish! You should eat high quality meat with a
good balance of fat and red meat. Eat plenty
of it! Well then, best of luck!

89.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, let's avoid
carbs. You should go for that one dish
consisting of just beef! Oh, you're free to eat
pickled red ginger with it too! Well then, best
of luck!

90.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! Now, let's go for a
bulk-up menu! Let's see... I suggest you go
to a fast food chain and order something that
offers double the average amount of meat.
That'll put a smile on your face! Well then,
best of luck!

91.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, let's cut calories
and focus on nutrient intake! Let's see... You
should go to a fast food chain and only have
vegetables. It's one of their standard dishes.
Well then, best of luck!

92.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, let's try 
something out of the ordinary. Let's see...
How about a round food that comes with
cheese on top? It's apparently most popular
with women. You can eat it at a counter!
Well then, best of luck!

93.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, let's go meat
only! Meat is the best for building muscle!
I'm suggesting something that's relatively low
in fat! It's best when cooked on a grill. Well
then, best of luck!

94.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! You can't go wrong with
meat after a workout! Just this one time, I'll
let you have some popular yakiniku! Well then,
best of luck!

95.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! You should eat some fish
once in a while! Let's have that one fish
Japanese people just love! How about a dish
that allows you to enjoy various parts of it?
Well then, best of luck!

96.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, we'll aim for a
dish that'll bulk you up, but is also easy to eat!
A standard light meal that includes eggs, meat,
and vegetables would be good! A meal like that
is usually offered in the morning. Well then,
best of luck!

97.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, we'll go with a
dish that consists of meat and vegetables! Let's
see... How about one where you can enjoy five
different types of it? It all comes served on a
skewer! Well then, best of luck!

98.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! Let's try an unusual dish
this time! I suggest some bite-sized grilled
fish. It's chock-full of calcium and protein!
The flavorful roe will have you hooked! Well
then, best of luck!

99.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, let's focus more
on nutrition! How about a dish that contains a
lot of scallions? You'll be tempted to drink
alcohol, but please try your best to resist it.
Well then, best of luck!

100.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! Now, we'll focus heavily
on protein! Let's see... You should eat an
entire, delicious chicken thigh! They're great
to eat after training, but keep it mild! Well
then, best of luck!

101.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! You should eat some junk
food once in a while to bulk up! Let's see...
How about a fast food place where you can eat
a good, old-fashioned, sunny-side up egg? Well
then, best of luck!

102.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, let's go with a
bulk-up menu that'll have you consume plenty
of carbs! It's the national dish that everyone
loves! Please get the one with beef! Well then,
best of luck!

103.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, you should
consume carbs and vegetables! Make sure
it's heavy on the vegetables! This meal is
famous as a Nagasaki specialty! Well then,
best of luck!

104.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, we'll focus on
veggies! Did you know ginger also has tons
of digestive health benefits? I want you to
combine a ton of veggies with ginger!

There's a popular chain that's been in town
for years that serves up some great veggie
dishes.

105.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, protein will be
our main focus! I suggest a meal that offers a
lot of vegetable protein! It might be good for
the appetite if it's on the spicier side. Well
then, best of luck!

106.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! Now, let's go with a dish
that contains both pork and veggies! Make
sure it's something that'll fill you up! Cabbage
would be good for the vegetable! Well then,
best of luck!

107.2:
Hi there, Kiryu-san! This time, let's maintain a
good balance of vitamins and protein! I suggest
going for vegetables and chicken! Steamed
chicken breasts would be ideal! Well then, best
of luck!

1.2:
I'd love to talk with you more. <symbol=note_with_outline> Want to meet
up outside the club? Anywhere's fine, as long as
we can relax or get some exercise! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

Send me the invitation sticker if you're up for
it! <symbol=note_with_outline>

2.2:
I'm so happy you invited me out! <symbol=heart_with_outline>
I'm really really really looking forward to it!
I'll be waiting at Theater Square. <symbol=note_with_outline>

3.2:
Oh, uh, not this sticker. I need that invitation
sticker! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

4.2: Huh? I'm confused. Are you mad?

5.2:
In a good mood? <symbol=note_with_outline> If you want to meet up,
send me the invitation sticker! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

6.2:
Did I catch you off guard? Well, if you send me
the invitation sticker, we can meet up! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

7.2:
That one's cute! But it's not the invitation
sticker I'm looking for...

8.2:
Are you sad? Maybe it would feel better to have
some fun? Just send me the invitation sticker if
you want to...

9.2:
Don't worry, you! <symbol=note_with_outline> Send me the invitation
sticker and you'll be fine! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

10.2:
No need to thank me! If you send the invitation
sticker, we can meet up! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

1.2:
Wouldn't it be fun to hang out outside the club?
<symbol=note_with_outline> I'd love it if you took me somewhere I don't
usually go... Send me an invitation sticker if
you're up for it! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

2.2:
Thanks for the invitation! <symbol=note_with_outline>
I'll be waiting at Theater Square.<symbol=heart_with_outline>
Excited to see where we'll go! <symbol=heart_with_outline><symbol=heart_with_outline>

3.2:
Okay? <symbol=heart_with_outline> Be more clear! If you send me an
invitation sticker, I'll tell you where to
meet me...<symbol=heart_with_outline>

5.2:
Is that a hint? Send me the invitation sticker if
you want to hang out! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

6.2: Is this all too sudden, maybe?

7.2:
That sticker's so cute! But if you want to hang 
out, send me the invitation sticker, okay? <symbol=heart_with_outline>

9.2:
Are you confused? <symbol=heart_with_outline> If you send me the
invitation sticker, I promise we'll get together
soon! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

10.2:
You don't have to thank me... <symbol=heart_with_outline>
Just invite me with an invitation sticker! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

1.2:
Would you like to hang out sometime? No rush,
whenever you're free. I just want to talk to you
more. Send me the invitation sticker whenever
you're feeling up to it! ^^

2.2:
I'm so happy you invited me out! <symbol=heart_with_outline>
Wonder where you'll take me?
I'll meet you at Theater Square. <symbol=note_with_outline>

3.2:
I'm so happy! If you send me the invitation
sticker, I'll tell you where to meet me... ;)

4.2:
...What does that mean?
You don't want to meet up?

5.2:
Oh, just send me the invitation sticker already,
would you? <symbol=heart_with_outline>

7.2:
That's so cute! ^_^  Send me the invitation
sticker and we can meet up. <symbol=heart_with_outline>

10.2:
You're so polite, Kiryu-san. <symbol=note_with_outline> Send me the
invitation sticker whenever you're ready. <symbol=heart_with_outline>

1.2:
I don't go out with too many guys, but I
wouldn't mind hanging out with you, Kiryu-san.
If you're up to it, send me the invitation
sticker, okay? I'll wait by the phone. <symbol=heart_with_outline>

2.2:
Thanks a ton! I'm pretty excited... <symbol=heart_with_outline>
I'll meet you at Theater Square! <symbol=note_with_outline>

3.2:
Nice. <symbol=heart_with_outline> Send me the invitation sticker if you
want to meet up, though. <symbol=heart_with_outline>

7.2:
Aww, you're cheering for me? <symbol=heart_with_outline> If you send
me the invitation sticker, we can meet up! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

10.2:
lol, so old-fashioned, Kiryu-san! <symbol=note_with_outline>
Just send the invitation sticker. <symbol=heart_with_outline>

1.2:
I'm feeling like karaoke or something!
I've got dibs on the anime songs, tho. <symbol=note_with_outline>
Or we can do something else? Whatever you
want! If you're up to it, just send me the
invitation sticker, okay? <symbol=heart_with_outline>

2.2:
Yay, this is gonna be so fun! <symbol=note_with_outline>
Let's meet at Theater Square. <symbol=heart_with_outline>

3.2:
Okay! <symbol=note_with_outline> If you send me the invitation sticker,
we can totally meet up. <symbol=heart_with_outline>

4.2: I don't get why you're upset...

5.2:
Yay! Don't tease me, though! Send me that
invitation sticker! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

6.2:
Why so surprised? If you send me the invitation
sticker, we can meet up, honest! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

9.2:
Nothing to be scared of! <symbol=note_with_outline> If you send me the
invitation sticker, I'll be waiting for you. You'll
find me, I promise. <symbol=heart_with_outline>

10.2:
lol, why are you thanking me?
Send me the invitation sticker! <symbol=heart_with_outline>

1.2:
Kiryu-san!
It's Sodachi. I've finally gotten strong enough
to earn the title of the strongest. I'll be waiting
at the Children's Park. You haven't even seen
my final form!

1.1: This Truly is the Final Attack
1.2:
I've finally figured out the ultimate self-defense
technique. However, it's not complete yet. I
need to defeat you with it to truly complete it,
Kiryu-san. Please accept this challenge. I'll be
waiting at the Ropeway Station.

Smartphones are so useful! I'm at New Gaudi
right now. You should come on over, too,
Kiryu-san!

Hey, are you free?
I could use a hand with something.

2.2:
Can you head over to a convenience store
and buy me some prepaid cards?

3.2:
Don't worry what they are.
Just get them for me.

5.2: Tell me when you have them.

6.2:
Good. Now send me photos of the numbers on
each one.

9.2:
Just send them already.
I'm in a hurry here.

11.2: The roof of the Senryo Building.

12.2: What the hell's going on, Kiryu!?

13.2:
Kiryu, you've been had!
My account got hacked the other day!

14.2: That wasn't me you were talking to!

15.2: Your 50 grand could be anywhere by now!

17.2:
I'll see what I can do.
That scammer's not getting away with this.

18.2:
Sorry, 50 grand's a lot to lose.
I'll buy you a drink sometime to make up for it.

19.2: Kiryu, I just found out my account got hacked!

21.2: You ran into some criminals? Where?

22.2: I'll send some guys to clean this up.

23.2:
Spare me the details, but it sounds like I owe 
you a drink.

1.2:
Kazuma Kiryu, my eternal rival.
The time has come yet again.

I await you on my floating island.
-Jo Amon

2.2:
Nice to meet you! My name's Hiro. I distribute
the Tips Newsletter!

This newsletter will tell you everything you
need to know to get the most out of your
game. 

If there's something you don't understand, I
hope you'll look to us for help!

10.2: I'm excited to talk to you, too.

12.2:
Hahaha! That's impossible. Although, I'd
love to grab a drink with you if I could.

13.2:
This is Hiro from the Tips Newsletter!

Today we'll talk about saving. This game has 
an auto-save function, so you don't need to
find phone booths. It's 2016, right? Keep in
mind, when the save mark is being displayed,
don't turn off the system as it could corrupt
your data.

If you'd rather manually save the game, select
"Settings" from your phone and you'll find the
option there. You can't manually save during
events or battles. 

Your save data acts as a bookmark so you can
pick up the game from wherever you left off.
Continue a saved game by selecting "Continue"
from the Title Screen.

14.2:
This is Hiro from the Tips Newsletter!

This newsletter is all about the map. The mini
map is displayed in the lower-left corner,
showing your surroundings, points of interest,
and enemies. Just press <Action=View_Map,Adventure> 
to display the entire map, which you can create
waypoint markers on! Use both maps to figure
out where you're headed and how to get there!

15.2:
This is Hiro from the Tips Newsletter!

While wandering out in the world, you can
sprint by holding down <Sign:9,Adventure>.
Compared to your normal speed, you'll run 
a lot faster. However, if you run for too long,
you'll become winded.
Let go of <Sign:9,Adventure> and catch your breath
when needed. Pacing yourself is important! If
you want to sprint for longer stretches, there
are upgrades for that in the Stats Menu.

16.2:
This is Hiro from the Tips Newsletter!

When you press <Sign:8,Adventure> while you have control of
Kiryu, you'll shift to a first-person perspective.
It can feel very immersive to see the world
through Kiryu's eyes. You may even find secrets
while in the first-person point of view that
you wouldn't have seen otherwise. However, if
you get in a fight or start a conversation, you'll
switch back to third-person view.

17.2:
This is Hiro from the Tips Newsletter!

I want to tell you about an app called "Awards"
on your smartphone. You'll earn some valuable
EXP for objectives you complete here. Clearing
some easy objectives is a good way to get EXP
early on. New objectives become available as
you clear previous ones, so keep at them as
much as you can.

18.2:
This is Hiro from the Tips Newsletter!

There are some great local restaurants to check
out when you just want to relax, recover lost
health, and gain a bit of EXP. Certain meal
combinations may even give you bonus EXP. 

But don't go too crazy! Eating after you're
already full will recover health, but not grant
EXP. How do you get hungry again? By burning
calories, silly! Whether it's running around the
city or beating up street trash, you're sure to
work up an appetite doing what you do best!

19.2:
This is Hiro from the Tips Newsletter!

Did you know you can change the time of day
by accessing either the waiting room door of
New Serena in Kamurocho, or the futon at the
Navy Apartments when you're in Onomichi?
Keep in mind, you won't be able to change the
time of day at certain points in the story. You
can choose either Day or Night in Kamurocho,
and Day, Dusk, or Night in Onomichi. Certain
events only happen during specific times, so be
sure to explore at all different times.

20.1: Pros and Cons of Getting Drunk
20.2:
This is Hiro from the Tips Newsletter!

Just like real life, if you consume too much
alcohol, you'll get drunk. You can sober up
by drinking water or even just letting it wear
off as time passes. When you're drunk, people
around the city are more likely to pick a fight
with you. At the same time, your Heat Orbs
will fill faster, so sometimes you may want to
get drunk.

21.2:
This is Hiro from the Tips Newsletter!

As you advance through the story, you'll find
items that are considered Valuables. Valuables
have their own tab in the Items Menu where
you can read descriptions of each one.
Valuables are often items that are important
to the story. You cannot throw away or sell
Valuables.

22.2:
This is Hiro from the Tips Newsletter!

When you obtain DLC, a cardboard box will be
delivered to either New Serena in Kamurocho
or the Navy Apartments in Onomichi. Check
the box to unlock your DLC. You can only
unlock DLC once per save file.

123.2:
This is Hiro from the Tips Newsletter!

If you obtain a new outfit, you can change into
it at New Serena in Kamurocho or the Navy
Apartments in Onomichi. Note that you can
only change your outfit in Premium Adventure
mode.

131.2: I'm excited to talk to you, too.

133.2:
Hahaha! That's impossible. Although, I'd
love to grab a drink with you if I could.

134.2:
This is Hiro from the Tips Newsletter!

Congratulations! All award objectives have
been cleared! To show our gratitude for your
dedication, we at Tips Newsletter would like
to present you with a congratulatory item called
the "War God Talisman"!

A box containing the talisman will be delivered
to New Serena in Kamurocho or the Navy
Apartments in Onomichi. On behalf of all of us,
thank you.

142.2: I'm excited to talk to you, too.

144.2:
Hahaha! That's impossible. Although, I'd
love to grab a drink with you if I could.

2.2:
Do you want to become stronger? Sure, we all
do. So, read my emails to find out just how
easy it is. First we have to get you used to
performing simple attacks. 

<Sign:2,Combat><Sign:1,Combat><Sign:1,Combat>
<Sign:2,Combat><Sign:2,Combat><Sign:1,Combat><Sign:1,Combat>
<Sign:2,Combat><Sign:2,Combat><Sign:2,Combat><Sign:1,Combat><Sign:1,Combat>
<Sign:2,Combat><Sign:2,Combat><Sign:2,Combat><Sign:2,Combat><Sign:1,Combat><Sign:1,Combat>

 - Battle Master

3.2:
You got that quick.
Keep at it just like that.

4.2:
Unleash that anger of yours in the heat of
battle.

8.2: What are you so down about?

10.2: Don't let it get to you.

12.2: What do you mean by that?

13.2:
It looks like you're pretty out of shape. So, I'll
need to teach you the basics again. Sure,
attacking is important in a fight, but defense
can be even more crucial. Practice using all
of the following defenses: 

Hold <Sign:4,Combat> while moving to strafe around an
enemy.

Hold <Sign:6,Combat> to guard against enemy attacks.

Press <Sign: 3,Combat> to Quickstep.

If you can do those, just wait for an opening
and then unleash your attacks.

 - Battle Master

14.2:
You got that quick.
Keep at it just like that.

15.2:
Unleash that anger of yours in the heat of
battle.

19.2: What are you so down about?

21.2: Don't let it get to you.

23.2: What do you mean by that?

24.2:
Have you gotten any new gear yet? The gear
you get can be equipped by selecting "Stats"
in the Pause Menu, then pressing <Sign:6,UI>
or <Sign:4,UI> to toggle to "Equip."
Equipping better gear will enhance your stats,
and strong enough gear can even give you
an edge over strong foes.

- Battle Master

25.2:
You got that quick.
Keep at it just like that.

26.2:
Unleash that anger of yours in the heat of
battle.

30.2: What are you so down about?

32.2: Don't let it get to you.

34.2: What do you mean by that?

35.2:
After obtaining some experience points (EXP),
select Stats in the Pause Menu to spend them on
increasing your stats and learning new skills.
You should first increase your Basic Stats. Once
you've raised your Basic Stats a bit, the rest
is completely up to you. Learn skills that shape
your own personal fighting style.
Remember: When you get EXP, use it!

 - Battle Master

36.2:
You got that quick.
Keep at it just like that.

37.2:
Unleash that anger of yours in the heat of
battle.

41.2: What are you so down about?

43.2: Don't let it get to you.

45.2: What do you mean by that?

46.2:
So you're probably getting used to battles by
now. That's great! But, don't you hate being
surrounded by enemies and assaulted from all
sides? Don't worry! In those situations, grab an
enemy with <Sign:0,Combat>, then press <Sign:0,Combat> again to throw
them. You can do this to knock down
surrounding enemies as well.  

Have you ever had a difficult time with speedy
enemies? For quick foes, grab them using <Sign:0,Combat>,
then perform a grab attack by pressing <Sign:2,Combat> or
<Sign:1,Combat>. Stopping an enemy's movement is the most
surefire way to cause damage.

You can also pick up weapons lying around
town with <Sign:0,Combat>. Weapons like knives and firearms
can't be guarded against, so use them whenever
you can. You have to be prepared to defend
yourself against people who don't fight fair.

 - Battle Master

47.2:
You got that quick.
Keep at it just like that.

48.2:
Unleash that anger of yours in the heat of
battle.

52.2: What are you so down about?

54.2: Don't let it get to you.

56.2: What do you mean by that?

57.2:
As you land attacks during battle, you'll notice
that the Heat Orbs near your Health Bar will
fill up. Once an Orb fills up, you can use it
to perform a special attack known as a Heat
Action. When the Heat Icon shows up, press
<Sign:1,Combat> to unleash a furious Heat Action. However,
each Heat Action can only be activated under
certain conditions. You'll have to experiment
and learn when you can use each Heat Action.

 - Battle Master

58.2:
You got that quick.
Keep at it just like that.

59.2:
Unleash that anger of yours in the heat of
battle.

63.2: What are you so down about?

65.2: Don't let it get to you.

67.2: What do you mean by that?

68.2:
It looks like a lot of your fighting instincts
have returned, so now I can teach you about
a special state called Extreme Heat Mode. After
gathering several Heat Orbs, press <Sign:5,Combat> to enter
Extreme Heat Mode. During Extreme Heat Mode,
you'll have a blue aura surrounding you. Not
only will your attack power increase, but you
can activate special Heat Actions that are
exclusive to this mode.

How long Extreme Heat Mode lasts depends on
how many Heat Orbs you've filled up. The more
Orbs, the longer it lasts. When fighting a
strong enemy, conserve your Heat Orbs and
overwhelm them with Extreme Heat Mode.

I look forward to the day I can fight you.

 - Battle Master

69.2:
You got that quick.
Keep at it just like that.

70.2:
Unleash that anger of yours in the heat of
battle.

74.2: What are you so down about?

76.2: Don't let it get to you.

78.2: What do you mean by that?

79.2:
Long time no see. I've watched you for a while,
and it seems your fighting skills are pretty top
notch now. Therefore, this will be my final
advice to you.

As the Dragon of Dojima, you must understand
that training can only take you so far. If you
haven't yet, master your Basic Stats to the max.
Only then can you push beyond your limits.

I'll contact you again... when the time is right.

Until then, keep on training.

 - Battle Master

80.2:
You got that quick.
Keep at it just like that.

81.2:
Unleash that anger of yours in the heat of
battle.

85.2: What are you so down about?

87.2: Don't let it get to you.

89.2: What do you mean by that?

1.2:
This is Torafuru.

I knew you could do it, Kiryu-san! Looks like
you drove the shakedown army out of the
city. They don't want to mess with you again.
You've brought this town one step closer to
peace. Thank you!

12.2:
This is Torafuru.

Wow! What an incredible job, Kiryu-san!
Those guys were seeking out middle-aged
men to assault, but you sent them packing!
Please continue to help however you can!

23.2:
This is Torafuru.

Those pick-up artists were going around
tricking a lot of girls. Thankfully, they
shouldn't con anyone else now that you've
taught them some manners. You're really
turning this town around for the better.
Thank you!

34.2:
This is Torafuru.

It turns out those guys had committed a lot
of assaults as a mob in this city. 

You inspired some courage in people who
saw you fight without any fear against guys
like that, Kiryu-san. Thank you!

45.2:
This is Torafuru.

Those guys were notorious as monsters who
target couples. What do you think warped their
hearts? Oh well. We don't have to worry about
them. They won't show their faces around here
anymore. Thank you so much!

56.2:
This is Torafuru.

I'm sorry, but I had to laugh. I never thought I
would see you deliver ramen. It might have
been a pain in the ass, but I'm sure you saved
that restaurant... lol. You're doing great work!

67.2:
This is Torafuru.

That settles the series of arsons that had been
happening in Kamurocho. If it weren't for you,
there could have been a serious disaster in this
city. You really saved us all. Thank you!

78.2:
This is Torafuru.

That settles the series of arsons that had
been happening in Onomichi. If it weren't
for Troublr, we might not have been able
to stop it. I'm thinking of taking this system
nationwide. Let's work together to keep the
peace in this city. I can't thank you enough!

89.2:
This is Torafuru.

I guess you could say you're in big trouble if
you run out of toilet paper... lol. I'm in awe of
your kindness! It's nice to solve small problems
like this once in a while for a change of pace.

100.2:
This is Torafuru.

That was a really dangerous criminal. I wish
the police would catch people like that and
keep them off the streets. You've done a
great service to your fellow man, Kiryu-san.
Thank you so much!

111.2:
This is Torafuru.

There's a correlation between the crime rate
in a city and the amount of purse-snatchers.
Without any witnesses, victims generally have
no option but to give up. You were able to
catch them in the act of the crime, though.
Thank you!

122.2:
This is Torafuru.

I think this city is still very dangerous. The
guy who was caught was apparently an infamous
pickpocket according to the police. Looks like
he was outclassed this time. LOL. Thank you,
Kiryu-san!

133.2:
This is Torafuru.

You really saved us. He might have been the
most terrifying threat so far. You can make
bombs so easily nowadays... So we can't rule
out the possibility that more bombers might
appear later. I'll keep a look out. Thank you!

144.2:
This is Torafuru.

Thanks to you, this city has become much
more peaceful. I think as long as we keep an
eye on Troublr, we'll be able to manage. 

You're an inspiration, Kiryu-san. I want to
become strong like you. I want to protect
this city with my own strength, rather than
always depending on others.

That's how I feel now. I'll keep working at it.
Thank you for everything. Goodbye.

1.2:
This is the Kamurocho Information Service.

This service will automatically distribute
updates on Kamurocho's facilities and road
conditions.

***NOTICE***
Access to Park Boulevard is limited due to
major construction on the sewers on the north
side of Shichifuku Street. Pedestrians and
drivers should exercise caution while in the
area.

34.2:
This is the Kamurocho Information Service.

***NOTICE***
We have just received an eyewitness report of a
massive UFO in the skies above Kamurocho and
Onomichi! Apparently you can see it if you
equip an item called the UFO Finder! If you are
in Kamurocho, look toward the Millennium Tower
from the roof of a building. If you are in
Onomichi, find some high ground and look up at
the sky.

45.2:
This is the Kamurocho Information Service.

***NOTICE***
Have you heard? A rumor has been spreading
that you can take pictures of ghosts in
Kamurocho. Reports say the phenomenon is
tied to some mysterious photographs. If you
hold one of these photographs, you might feel
yourself shudder as you pass by a certain
location. Try taking a picture there, and you
might see something that's not meant to be
seen...

1.2:
Kiryu-san,

That back-alley merchant that I talked to you
about the other day gave me a call. He said it
was okay for me to tell you about him, so if
you want to meet him, you should check out the
vacant lot in Hana-no-kubo.

Yo Kiryu-san,
It's been a while. You remember the back-alley
merchant in Onomichi mentioning his counterpart
in Kamurocho?

Well I got word that he's already heard about
you, so you should go introduce yourself when
you get a chance. I hear he hangs out deep in
the sewer system.
